fields.summary: SELinux blocks eucalyptus-cloud access to LDAP

comments.body: [~jgallucci32], could you provide state for newly registered SC after step 2? Have you provide log from old or new SC host?

[~vasya], I submitted the logs to the support portal
https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/requests/1772

After Step 2, the newly registered SC is in the "broken" state with the error messaging saying in need to set a blockstoragemanager setting as described in the initial install instructions

I noticed a few things:
* This did not affect the similar steps taken to add a new CC node and remove an old one (I did this twice for two AZs)
* When I restart the UFS services where are on a different node, the SC node reports the service registration with a similar error
{noformat}
2017-01-10 17:28:37 ERROR | CHECK:null  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_52:imaging:API_52.imaging/ DISABLED->DISABLED=DISABLED [Transition request state=DISABLED rejected because of an ongoing transition: State:name=arn:euca:bootstrap:API_52:imaging:API_52.imaging/:state=DISABLED:mark=true:transition=TRANSITION arn:euca:bootstrap:API_52:imaging:API_52.imaging/ #854 DISABLED_CHECK ActiveTransition name=DISABLED_CHECK from=DISABLED/false to=DISABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=CHECK id=854 startTime=Tue Jan 10 17:28:37 PST 2017]
2017-01-10 17:28:39 ERROR | START:DISABLED  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_52:user-api:API_52/ DISABLED->DISABLED=DISABLED [Transition request state=DISABLED rejected because of an ongoing transition: State:name=arn:euca:bootstrap:API_52:user-api:API_52/:state=DISABLED:mark=true:transition=TRANSITION arn:euca:bootstrap:API_52:user-api:API_52/ #1056 DISABLED_CHECK ActiveTransition name=DISABLED_CHECK from=DISABLED/false to=DISABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=CHECK id=1056 startTime=Tue Jan 10 17:28:39 PST 2017]
{noformat}

[~vasya], Sorry I should have mentioned earlier, the old SC is running on RHEL6 (upgraded from 4.2.2 to 4.3.0.1). The new SC is running on RHEL7 (clean 4.3.0.1 install).

A big difference I see in the logs when the service starts, the new SC complains about not connecting to LDAP, and it seems that error keeps the storage component stuck in the "INITIALIZED" state. On the old SC, it doesn't have an LDAP error and the storage component goes into the "DISABLED" state.
[~jgallucci32], have you been able to register SC component after setting SELINUX  to permissive mode ?  Is everything working as expected in your cloud now ?

[~kshaik], yes I was able to register the SC after setting it to permissive. I decided to rebuild the server and keep it in enforcing mode using the following selinux modifications for Eucalyptus (temporary until they are in the official release):
{code}
 - name: Install python modules for ansible selinux support
   yum: name=libsemanage-python,policycoreutils-python state=installed

 - name: Configure selinux for storage controller (EUCA-13102)
   seboolean: name=eucalyptus_storage_controller
              state=yes
              persistent=yes

 - name: Configure selinux to allow ldap connection (EUCA-13102)
   selinux_permissive: name=eucalyptus_cloud_t
                       permissive=true
{code}
Note this is specific to an ansible playbook. The general idea of seboolean and selinux_permissive can be extracted and applied to the command line.

There are two issues involved here:

# The {{eucalyptus_storage_controller}} boolean was unset, as you discovered using {{audit2allow}}.
# A bug, EUCA-7102, in which storage controllers try to pull LDAP data.

{{eucalyptus-cloud}} processes should be able to pull data down from LDAP regardless, so the code fix for this issue will simply be to allow it to do so in its SELinux policy.

I can confirm these are two separate issues. When updating my UFS nodes to RHEL7, I only had to set {{eucalyptus_cloud_t}} to permissive. There were no issues with boolean settings. I'm assuming same will be the case for the CLC node when I get to that upgrade.

Setting eucalyptus_cloud_t to permissive bypasses all SELinux restrictions for that type of process, including those that you normally allow if you set {{eucalyptus_storage_controller}}.  If you wish, feel free to install eucalyptus-selinux-0.1.18 on 4.3 systems and see if it solves the issue.  It should appear in the eucalyptus 4.4 nightly package repositories after tonight.

Understood, this was merely my workaround to avoid setting the whole system to permissive. This is my production system so I'm hesitant to apply the nightly build to it, but i'll take a look at the changes.
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
